# The YEG in a nutshell

<p class="plain-text">
Together with <a href='https://sites.google.com/view/sophiemdupont/home'>Sophie M Dupont</a>, we are proud to participate in the coordination of the Young Ecotoxicologist Group (YEG) from the <a href='https://eng-ecotox.hub.inrae.fr/'>French ECOTOX network</a>. 
The group aims to create a dynamic and inclusive environment for young researchers in ecotoxicology, promoting interactions and collaboration, and enhancing professional development. </p>  

<p class="plain-text">
The YEG is a key network for sharing experiences and spreading information about events, job offers, and funding opportunities. It also focuses on promoting the exchange of scientific knowledge through monthly webinars and active discussion channels.</p>

<p class="plain-text">
Are you a Master's student, PhD candidate, research engineer, or post-doctoral researcher? Join us and be part of a dynamic community to imporve our understanding of how contaminants affect organisms.</p>


For a quick overview about the role of the YEG, check the poster we have presented to the <a href='https://asso-sefa.fr/colloque-de-la-sefa'>French SEFA meeting 2024</a> below:
